lines.content: Type todo followed by the description of the task.
`Now you have 1 task in the list`
Add a task that has a deadline.
Type deadline followed by the description of the task. Then type '/by' and the date
of the deadline in the format yyyy-mm-dd.
`Now you have 2 tasks in the list`
Add an event that has a date.
Type event followed by the description of the task. Then type '/at' and the time
`Now you have 3 tasks in the list`
`Here are the tasks in your list`
Type done and the index of the task that you want to mark as done.
`Nice! I've marked this task as done:`
delete a task from the task list.
Type delete and the index of the task that you want to delete.
`Now you have 2 tasks in the list`
find tasks that matche the keyword from the task list.
Type find followed by the keyword.
`Here are the matching tasks in your list:`
`Bye. Hope to see you again soon!`
* Command contains the name of the command and the description of the command.
* Judges whether the user wants to exit.
* @return isExit boolean tpye. True means exit and false means not exit.
* Stores the tasklist into local file.
* Deadline is a class that inherits from the Task class.
* It contains the description (string) and the deadline date (LocalDate).
* @return deadline task in the format [D][tick or cross] + description + (by: MMM d yyyy)
* @param filePath String. The path of the local data file.
* Event is a class that inherits from the Task class.
* It contains the description (string) and the event date (String).
* @return event task in the format [E][tick or cross] + description + (at: time)
* Parser class deals with making sense of the user command
* Parser formats the user input and output a command c
* @param userInput String of the user input.
* @return Command c. A command that contains the name of the command (string) and the description of the command (string).

* load the history data into the task list
* @return tasks. Its type is ArrayList<Task> storing the history data.
* @throws FileNotFoundException the file given the filepath does not exist.
public static ArrayList<Task> load() throws FileNotFoundException {

* Write the task list to the file given the filepath.
* @throws IOException error occurs when storing the data into the local file.
public static void writeToFile() throws IOException {
* Process the string to follow the format like T | 1 | get up.
* T indicates it is a to do task. D indicates it is a deadline task. E indicates it is an event task.
* get up in the example is the descripiton of the task.
* Task is a class that has three subclasses to do, deadline and event.
* It contains the description (string) and the status of the class (boolean, done or not).
* Gets the corresponding icon for the current status.
* Sets the status of the task
* @return task in the format [tick or cross] + description
* TaskList contains the list of the added tasks implemented by Arraylist
* Returns the size of the task list
* Returns the task corresponding to the index
* @param i integer. Index of the task.
* Deletes the task corresponding to the index
* @param index indeger. Index of the task.
* Adds a task to the task list.
* @param size the size of the current task list.
* @param t the task object that user wants to add into the task list. It can be a to do, deadline or event task.
public static void add(int size, Task t) {
* @param userInput A string containing the indexes of tasks to be marked as done, separated by ' '.
* Deletes a task. Show warning messages if delete 0 or more than 1 task.
* @param userInput A string containing the indexes of tasks to be deleted, separated by ' '.
* @param count Integer. Number of currect tasks in the task list.
public static void deleteTasks(String userInput, int count) {
* Finds the tasks corresponding to the key words.
* @return An array list taskFound containing all the matching tasks.
* To do is a class that inherits from the Task class.
* It contains the description of the to do task.
* @return to do task in the format [T][tick or cross] + description
* Ui class deals with interactions with the user.
print(" What can I do for you?");
* @param text String that will be printed out.
* @param t Task that will be printed out.
* Shows the message when loading error occurs.
print("Loading error occurs! Maybe because this is your first time. The file will be automatically created later.");
* Shows the message when user inputs an invalid command.
print(" OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
* Shows the message when user enters a non-number after done command.
print("  OOPS!!! Please enter a number after 'done' command.");
* Shows the message when user enters a number that beyond the length of the current task list after done command.
print("  OOPS!!! Please enter valid numbers after 'done' command.");
* Marks the corresponding tasks as don, and show the message
* that the tasks has been successfully marked as done.
* @param words An array of String indicating the indexes of tasks that the user wants to mark as done.
print("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
* Shows the message when user just enters a delete without any number.
print("  OOPS!!! You are not deleting any task.");
* Shows the message when user wants to delete many tasks at the same time.
print("  OOPS!!! Please enter just one number after 'delete' command.");
* Shows the message when the deadline that user types in is not in the format yyyy-mm-dd.
print("Please enter the deadline date in the format yyyy-mm-dd");
* Shows the message when user enters a non-number after delete command.
print("  OOPS!!! Please enter a number after 'delete' command.");
* Shows the message when user enters a number that beyond the length of the current task list after delete command.
print("  OOPS!!! Please enter a valid number after 'delete' command.");
* Shows how many task left in the task list after removing a task.
* @param count integer. Number of current tasks in the task list.
print(("Now you have " + count + " tasks in the list").replace("1 tasks", "1 task"));
* Shows the message when user just enters deadline without any description.
print("  OOPS!!! The description of a deadline cannot be empty.");
* Shows the message when user does not enter the date of the deadline after "/by".
print("  OOPS!!! You also need to specify the time of a deadline.");
* Shows the message when user just enters event without any description.
print("  OOPS!!! The description of an event cannot be empty.");
* Shows the message when user does not enter the time of the event after "/at".
print("  OOPS!!! You also need to specify the time of an event.");
* Shows the tasks that match the user input.
print("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
* Shows the message when user just enters find without any description.
print(" OOPS!!! Please enter something after find command.");
* Shows the message when user just enters to do without any description.
print("  OOPS!!! The description of a todo cannot be empty.");
* @param e An exception caught when writing the task list to file.
* Shows the message to tell the user that the task has been successfully added.
* @param count Integer. Number of current tasks in the task list.
print("Got it. I've added this task.");
print("Now you have " + count + " task in the list");
print("Now you have " + count + " tasks in the list");
* @param count Integer. Number of current tasks in the task list.
print("Here are the tasks in your list:");
print("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
